alert.note: Alert for Vega Baja (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 23 at 9:50PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM AST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by previous excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Low lying areas along Rio Cibuco in Vega Baja. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM AST. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. River flooding may close down Route 2 between Vega Baja and Vega Alta. Routes 675 and 676 may also become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 842 PM AST, The USGS River Sensor is indicating that the river is in flood stage. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vega Baja, Monserrate and Sabana. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
